Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Evidence Statements: The student can draw materials before and after heating or cooling to show changes.
The student can illustrate the changes in ice when it melts into water and freezes back to ice.
The student can depict the change of a raw egg when it is cooked and explain why it cannot be reversed.
The student can identify and label changes that are reversible, like ice melting and refreezing.
The student can identify and label changes that are irreversible, like cooking an egg.
The student can draw and label the observable cause and effect of heating and cooling on materials.
